detaileddescription.para: This request writes the alarm value. The ctl argument is a pointer to an rtc_alarm_t which contains the alarm.
This request reads the alarm value. The ctl argument is a pointer to memory where the rtc_alarm_t will be stored.
This request disable the alarm. The ctl argument is NULL.
This request writes the value of the timer. For example: rtc_time_tthe_time; ioctl(rtc_fd,I_RTC_SET,&the_time);
This request reads the value of the timer. For example: rtc_time_tcurrent_time; ioctl(rtc_fd,I_RTC_GET,&current_time);
This request controls when the count action is triggered. The ctl argument is a rtc_event_count_t.
These are the values for clock of rtc_attr_t.
This lists the bit assignments when using the RTC interrupt callback.
Do not interrupt based on the count (default)
This lists the times when the count interrupt can be set.

briefdescription.para: Lists the days of the week.

detaileddescription.para: This is a list of the valid days of the week.

briefdescription.para: Lists the months of the year.

detaileddescription.para: This is a list of the valid months of the year.
This enumerates the valid alarm types.
